content.text: In the figure below, ABD is an equilateral triangle and ABCE is a trapezium. CDE is a straight line and $\angle DAE = 49^\circ$. Find $\angle CBD$. [Diagram: A geometric figure is shown. It consists of an equilateral triangle ABD and a trapezium ABCE. Points are labeled A, B, C, D, E. Point A is at the top-left, B at the top-right, E at the bottom-left, D on the base line between E and C, and C at the bottom-right. Line segments AE and BC are vertical and parallel, indicated by single arrows on them, forming the non-parallel sides of the trapezium ABCE. The base EC is horizontal. Triangle ABD is formed by connecting A, B, and D. An angle of $49^\circ$ is marked at vertex A, specifically for $\angle DAE$.]
content.text_latex: In the figure below, ABD is an equilateral triangle and ABCE is a trapezium. CDE is a straight line and $\angle DAE = 49^\circ$. Find $\angle CBD$.

diagrams.alt_text: A geometric figure showing a composite shape. It includes an equilateral triangle ABD and a trapezium ABCE. The vertices are labeled A, B, C, D, E. A is top-left, B is top-right. E is bottom-left, D is on the horizontal line segment EC, and C is bottom-right. Line segments AE and BC are vertical and parallel (indicated by single arrows). The line segment EC is horizontal. An angle of $49^\circ$ is marked at $\angle DAE$.
diagrams.description: A geometric figure showing a composite shape. It includes an equilateral triangle ABD and a trapezium ABCE. The vertices are labeled A, B, C, D, E. A is top-left, B is top-right. E is bottom-left, D is on the horizontal line segment EC, and C is bottom-right. Line segments AE and BC are vertical and parallel (indicated by single arrows). The line segment EC is horizontal. An angle of $49^\circ$ is marked at $\angle DAE$.
